dialogues.text: My hearing is not what it was. It sounded like you said you want me to preach at your funeral party with you sitting there? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) You know I've talked to God a lot about you over the years and he said he broke the mould when he made you. Said you were sure entertaining to watch but way too much trouble. Buddy grins. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you want me to say at this funeral? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want to, Charlie. CHARLIE (TO BUDDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you give us a minute? Buddy starts to get up. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit still. Buddy plops back down. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You scared to be alone with me? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can hear what's said. Buddy is surprised again. So is Charlie. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. After you left here.. did you do the right thing?
Felix looks up at the beautifully crafted pulpit. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.. what I thought was right. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You confessed? Asked forgiveness? Bush looks off and the muscles jump in his jaw. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell her, Felix? Charlie sighs, leans on his knees, and drops his head. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came a long way for nothing then. Bush's eyes jerk back to Charlie and they are hot. Buddy tenses. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You self-righteous.. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I built my own jail and put myself in it! And I stayed in it for 40 goddamn years! No wife, no kids, no friends! That's not enough? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it isn't. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears welling up) Well. Why don't you come and say that then, Charlie? Hell, say it all! I don't care. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on your life. The air is so heavy you can't breathe it. Bush suddenly g up and leaves. Buddy starts to follow. Charlie puts his h on him to stay. They sit in silence a moment. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you know about him?
BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost nothing, sir. I just work at the funeral home. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know he built this church? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?! (LOOKING AROUND)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's a man like him make something like this? I mean, I know he's a good carpenter but this is.. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic? (off Buddy's look) Maybe it's the best of him, maybe he put his soul into it, I don't know. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ya'll were talking about.. what did he do? Who was he supposed to tell? CHARLIE (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For him and God to know I guess. I wish I'd never been put between them, that's for sure. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will tell you that he showed up here half dead. I had just started preaching. Over the next 4 years we built this. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming to the funeral? Charlie sighs and looks around. 94A Omitted 94A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy and Bush are both lost in thought. Finally.. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?
BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. What are we doing? Since the day you came into the funeral home, I don't think anything has happened that you didn't want to happen. I just don't know where it's going. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a whole lot of things that you don't know. Like what a dog dreams. You can make up a story about him chasing rabbits but you don't know if there's rabbits in there or not. And he can't tell you, can he? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless he's a very special dog. They snort together. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People don't say what they mean either so you don't really know any more about them then you do about that dog's dream. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what..? BUSH (LOOKING AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That time you left my house I saw you stop and look back. You wanted to know what could make somebody like me. (off Buddy's uneasy look) Well here you are, son, here you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is putting money into a casket. He checks his watch FRANK (MUTTERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you..? Lighting flashes and the lights suddenly go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse creeps down the road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy looks tired. Bush is sitting up ramrod straight, thinking hard about something. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better stop and tell Frank we're back. He's probably had 2 or 3 hissy fits by now. (looks out at the rain) Why don't you stay the night at the house and I'll take you home in the morning? The simple kindness seems to short Bush out. Buddy doesn' notice, he's still looking ahead. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... I ain't stayed with nobody in a.. in a long while. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine if you want to. Bush looks as if he might say yes but he NOTICES where th car is passing through and.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the car. Bush starts to open the door. Buddy stops abruptly. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't walk. It's too far.. Bush climbs out with his shotgun. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the money in a casket.
BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might as well get back in, I'll follow you all the way. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps the gun closed) Get the hell out of here, boy! Buddy's eyes are defiant. Bush slams the door and walks a crossing over a fence and out into a dark field. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not responsible. Not responsible. Shit. He slams the steering wheel. 99 OMITTED 99 100 OMITTED 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy is putting the money into the foot of a casket. A l candelabra sits nearby. There is NOISE, like the muted so of something breaking. Buddy jerks and listens. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank? Hello? Mr. Bush? He stuffs the money into the casket, grabs the candelabra comes back, seals the lid, and starts into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the trees crooked rows of cold ghostly headstones glisten in the darkness. An old pocket lighter flares to reveal Bush staring at a pot of yellow flowers. He holds lighter to a tombstone and brushes away the debris. It re MARY LEE STROUP B. 1874 D. 1894. THUNDER rolls. Close on Bush's face as rain begins to fall.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep talking about forgiveness.. ask Jesus for forgiveness.. I never did nothing to Him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters with a flashlight. He sees that his desk and files have been ransacked. He rushes into the casket room Several caskets have been thrown to the floor. He goes to one where the money is, finds that it is sealed tight, an sighs with relief. Hearing something he whips the light around and sees Buddy on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank examines a cut and bump on top of Buddy's head by flashlight and dabs it gently with a cloth. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cut's not bad but how's the  head?  He moves his finger across Buddy's eyes. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow it. He looks him over carefully. He's had experience. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizzy? Double vision? Nauseous?  (off Buddy's no)  You'll be okay. Did you see who it  was? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was putting the money in.. heard glass breaking.. locked up the casket quick and.. boom.. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattie sits beside a fire, knitting a baby blanket by an lamp. All at once the lights sputter on, the radio lights warms, and begins to PLAY, as a KNOCK at the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattie pulls the door open. Bush is standing there soakin wet, breathing hard, holding his shotgun. She draws back reflexively. He looks into her. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush stands with a towel around him, shivering. Mattie opens a dresser drawer. Inside the drawer, is the carefully arranged tableau of a watch, a ring, a stethosc and some clothes. She hates to disturb the drawer but pul out a pair of black pants and a white shirt, lays them on bed, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattie steps from the kitchen with a steaming mug as Bush comes down the stairs in clothes that are too loose. Still shivering, Bush steps uneasily in front of the fire Mattie hands him the hot mug. He looks uneasily at the ye flowers on the table nearby. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Burned through, a log falls in the fire. Bush jerks oddly moves away. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I sit a minute? She stares at him then nods at a chair. She keeps standin behind the other chair. He bends over the mug and seems to lock up inside. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know why I have your sister's picture on my wall?
MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid, Felix. No, I take that back. How long was it going on? She was already married when I met you. Were you just making up to me to get to her? Bush is so still he looks like a gargoyle. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not going to talk, leave. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help who you love? Mattie's face tells us that she has asked herself that question many times. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had 40 years to think about it and I still don't know. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know either, so.. Slowly the gargoyle unfolds. His eyes drill into her. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell you how it was. If you don't want me to, I'll go. Mattie sighs from down deep in her shoes then comes aroun and sits down. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me. When did you take up with her? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to see you and she was there, hanging clothes on the line with your mama. Bush stares out the window so hard, Mattie turns to see w he is looking at.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turned around.. (as Mattie turns back) .and.. I promise you that I did not know that I had a heart till right then.
Tears well up in Mattie's eyes. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a fine fine girl. I didn't know why you wanted anything to do with me but I was gonna keep coming to see you 'till my luck ran out. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I saw her. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was married! And she wasn't just my sister, she was my best friend. We told each other everything. I can't.. how long did it go on?! Bush's face is so white it looks like a death mask. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still going on, Little Bit. Mattie tries to absorb that. The truth and tragedy of it touches her in way that she is not prepared for. They sit there in silence. She suddenly wipes her face and scowls. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have anything to do with her death? The mug trembles. She sees it. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. Like a fish jerked from the water, he mouth opens and clo but nothing comes out. MATTIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix! (off his haunted silence) Get out of my house! NOW! Bush stands up quickly and starts for the door. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And go to hell! BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been there.
He staggers, tries to catch himself but slides down again the wall. Despite her anger, Mattie starts toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush sits on the floor, pale as moonlight. Mattie is besi him with a stethoscope in her lap. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to see a doctor.. He raises his eyes to her but says nothing. They look int each other for a long moment. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me, Felix. Did you hurt Mary or not? Bush stares into her then suddenly gets up, picks up his shotgun and goes out the door without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is putting the files back in the drawers when he he a NOISE. He reaches into the drawer and turns with a pist in his hand. Bush is standing in the doorway with his shotgun. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?! Bush glances at the pistol, at the open drawers of the cabinet and desk. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get it? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Buddy sealed it up in a casket. Took a crack on the head, but.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold dark look) Is he all right? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.
BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was an army medic. He'll be fine. But Bush is still dark. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you ought to take those clothes back and get something in your size. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get the whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits with his feet on the desk. Bush sits across fr him. They each have a cup of whiskey. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought the money back, huh? (off Bush's absent nod) Listen, I've been thinking.. What if we had the party at your place? People are going to want to see the land they're getting so.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, think about it, we could.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know that I'm doing it. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking to call it off. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't! BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn well can if I want to. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no, it's in motion!
BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I say no, it's no. Send the money back. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're killing me! I bought things, hired people.. promised money, everybody in town is hoping to.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care about this town as much as they care about me. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you said you wanted and I've busted my ass for you. So why don't you want it anymore? You owe me that. BUSH (LONG BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the end of the line, tell it all, get out of jail party. But I guess I ain't got the goddamn guts to open my own mouth and I can't get nobody to talk for me so the hell with it. And to hell with me. Bush grabs his shotgun and goes. Frank sits, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy sits at the breakfast table, holding his son. He op and closes his eyes, checking out his vision. Kathryn, at stove, sees him out of the corner of her eye. KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having trouble seeing?  BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're mad. KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not mad. I'm concerned She shoves the skillet off the burner and comes to him. BUDDY (SQUINTS UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're mad. She tenderly touches his head.
KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could get my hands on whoever did this, you'd see mad.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Buddy! You up?! Frank rushes in, lifts a phantom hat to Kathryn, scrapes chair, pulls on the baby's toe, and looks at Buddy. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush is pulling out. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened yesterday? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, we went up to Illinois and met a preacher. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what happened? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked the preacher to come to the funeral. He said no. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch, that's got to be.. (TO KATHRYN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (to the baby) Sorry. Where's the preacher? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't do you any good. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows something about Bush, something bad, I think.
FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't say but.. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if Bush wants him, by God, Bush is gonna get him. KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slams the skillet down) You want eggs, Frank, or will the skillet do? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's wrong? KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? My husband has his head bashed in and all you care about is this party! FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that, Katie, this is for all of us. You're like.. family to me.. I.. KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not how family acts! FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry. I've never had any practice. (gets up/to Buddy) You okay? Buddy nods. Frank leaves. Buddy mutters to the baby..  BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of her way today, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattie is on her knees trying to plant bulbs in the hard ground. Her trowel barely gouges the earth. She stabs it again and again into the ground. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fool, it's too late for bulbs..
Suddenly she hurls the trowel as far as she can, then a handful of bulbs.. then her hat. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .too goddamn late..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy is surrounded by bags. He is copying down names ont raffle tickets and putting them in bin for the drawing. T is a MAN standing guard by the front door with a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mule stands with his ears back, upset. Bush, back in his clothes, is angrily planing a board. The box of his caske minus the lid is on sawhorses behind him. 119 OMITTED 119

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blurred image becomes clear as a magnifying glass lower to a page of a stamp collection book. Fingers fill an emp space with a prized addition. A LOUD KNOCKING startles hi and the stamp is placed slightly crooked.. Reveal Charlie Jackson scowling at the crooked stamp. He up, does a double-take out the window. MORE LOUD KNOCKING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie opens the door, sees Frank standing there. The he is parked outside. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Jackson? (Charlie looks at hearse) Frank Quinn, Quinn funeral home. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me? Frank just smiles, takes off his hat, and offers his hand Charlie gives him a long look and reluctantly motions him
Frank enters, noting the clean simple home of man with an orderly mind. Charlie motions for Frank to sit down. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to play some dominos this afternoon. But something told me to stay home. I should have played dominos. Is he out there? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush? No, sir. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sure. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you check the back? Frank snorts, liking Charlie immediately. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told Bush that you wouldn't come to the funeral? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he got that, why are you here? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To help you rethink it. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need any help. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you rethought it? (off Charlie's look) So there is a need. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, Bush doesn't know I'm here.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure about that. (off Frank's look) He's got a way of making people do what he wants them to. Frank squirms, knows it true. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he really a hermit? Frank whistles and takes Bush's poster out of his coat. Charlie jerks at the picture of the wild man. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to see me after he'd been  here, wants to call the party off. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he'd meant it to be a.. end of the line, tell it all, get out of jail funeral but that he didn't have the guts to open his mouth and he couldn't get anybody to talk for him. You know anything about that part? (off Charlie's sigh) At first he said he wanted everybody to come who had a story about him. But he didn't want to hear their bullshit stories, did he? Pardon my language. He wants to tell one, doesn't he?
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About time. FRANKFRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever he did, it's been locked up in him for 40 years and he can't get it out. (off Charlie's look) I think he told you. You may be the only person he told. And now he wants you to tell it for him. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he won't. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or can't. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or won't. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or can't.  (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he wants the truth to come  out, give him that. CHARLIE (LONG STARE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a boarding house around here? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd think. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but if you're not coming, I'm not going back. I made promises I can't keep to people I care about. This falls apart they won't blame Bush. Bank will take my business.. If I'm gonna have to start over again, might as well be from here. Charlie scowls at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a tool, Buddy unseals the casket to put the new mon in it and discovers that the rest of the money is gone? H can't believe it. He yanks back the casket bed lining.. 123 OMITTED 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush is sanding the beautiful lid of his casket. It is leaning against the wall and sawdust is drifting down all over him. He suddenly stops, rubs the wood tenderly, musc up the heavy top to put it on the box and staggers back. not the weight, something is wrong. Sweat pops out on his forehead. He forces himself to the casket and drops the t down hard, staggers back against the loft ladder, slides to the ground, and stares at the casket. Is this it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse sits on the side of the road. Road signs give mileage to different destinations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is lying in the back of the hearse, his head proppe on an old suitcase. He sips from his flask and stares out window, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush is still on the ground propped against the ladder. H eyes are closed and the fading light steals across his fa that is as still as it can be. The sawdust makes him look almost wooden. A shadow crosses then comes closer. Buddy is sure he is dead but Bush's eyes open. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, sir? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting a suntan. Bush starts to get up then falls back against the ladder.
BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you stuck? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no goddamn idea how right you are, son. Buddy moves to help him up but Bush waves him off. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sit here a minute. Bush looks at the butterfly bandage on Buddy's head. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a pair, ain't we? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sick? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just going through the motions. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Alive and there's Dead. And there's a worst place in between them that I hope you never know nothing about. (DARKENING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who hurt you? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonsabitches. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Listen. Frank went somewhere and the raffle money is gone. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figure he took off with it? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't want to think that. But the money's not here and I don't know where it is. He said he'd call and he never did.
Buddy glances into the shadows and sees the casket loomin the sawhorses. He stares at it.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.. what do you want to do? Buddy looks back at Bush. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.. (realizing just then) I want to make this funeral for you if you want it. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long look) Hell. Do it if you can. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess for everyone like me, there's one like you, son. I about forgot that. Buddy holds out his hand to help Bush up but Bush forces himself up on his own and walks out. 129 OMITTED 129

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sits at his desk, staring blankly at his crooked stamp. Suddenly Fate in the form of Frank Quinn looms at window. Charlie knows he is there but he won't look at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, Kathryn, and the baby are sleeping soundly. There SCRATCHING NOISE. Buddy sits up, grabs a baseball bat and falls back asleep. The scratching starts again. He opens eyes, surprised to see the bat in his hand. He hears the scratching. He looks around, sees something at the window slides to the floor, crawls on his knees, and looks out. Frank is standing there, scratching on the screen. Behind is Charlie, looking very unhappy about standing in the ne dark in a small southern town, scratching on a screen. Buddy realizes what he is seeing and starts to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Buddy, and Charlie are on the porch, watching the world come to life. Charlie looks as if he is hoping for kind of sign from above. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you decided to come, sir. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free will is not all that it's cracked up to be. BUDDY (AT FRANK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you take the money out of the casket? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?! FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot?! Where is it? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hearse, under the floorboards. Charlie remembers that Frank said he wasn't coming back a gives him a look. Buddy is giving Frank the same look. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Nobody steals a hearse. Now all we got to do is take the Reverend here to Bush and.. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you, Mr. Bush already said he would do it. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shittin' me?! Charlie gets up and starts walking away..
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I catch a train? FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave you just got here. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch and learn. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the station?

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: A tractor pulling a trailer with a big old honking genera on it, a truck loaded with equipment and workers for the event rumbles down a dirt road. The Quinn Funeral home he completes the unlikely parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush, dressed in his new suit, shirt, and shoes is a stri figure. The old hermit is gone. He looks into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton hold the car door open for Kathryn who is holding baby and looking back puzzled at Mattie's house. Finally sighs and gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattie stands staring out the window. She is not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of a wide clearing, a truck with a Circus Ad o the door is being set up to become a stage. The tractor and truck pull into the clearing and drive to circus truck. The hearse pulls in and parks. Frank, Buddy, and Charlie climb out of the hearse, look around, and stand frozen.
Trucks and cars are parked everywhere around the big clearing! Many PEOPLE have been here all night with fires tents and lean-tos. Many MORE PEOPLE are arriving now. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expecting a crowd? Frank and Buddy give each other a look. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly? We don't have a clue about what's going to happen here. SET-UP SEQUENCE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big old honking generator is unloaded. Holes are dug. foot poles are slid from the truck and huge speaker horns attached. Speaker poles are pulled up and set into holes. Frank directs a gang of 6 KIDS who are selling raffle tic making sure they know that he has his eyes on them. A BAND arrives on the back of pick-up truck. The Generator kicks on belching smoke everywhere. Frank i yelling Whoa Whoa! Disaster in the making.

dialogues.speaker: 136A OMITTED 136A
dialogues.text: 137 OMITTED 137 138 OMITTED 138
139 OMIT 139

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush stands staring out the checkerboard window. He sees Charlie approaching and opens the door for him. Charlie climbs the steps, appraises the shack, and stares at Bush CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty nice jail. Charlie enters and looks around the little room. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you change your mind? Charlie just looks at him, the unspoken words louder than reason he could give. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you want to do this? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. He gets a haunted look that catches Charlie off guard. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna try and tell it, Charlie, I really am. But if I can't get it done, would you do it? I want it said. Please, sir. Charlie sighs from down in his shoes and starts for the d BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell'em the box is in the barn. 141 OMIT 141

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's truck is half hidden off the road. Carl, Gary and THEMAN get out of the truck.

Carl tucks an old 45 in the back of his pants. Gary and Theman grab three gas cans off the truck, give one to Car and clamber down a deep gully and start up the other side Tom peeks out from behind the big garbage barrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The generator is working! And standing on the flat bed tr which is now a stage, an ANNOUNCER introduces a hot blue grass group The crowd is huge now and listens as the grou kicks off a song. Behind the stage Frank is collecting money from the boys are selling the raffle tickets, making them turn their pockets inside out. The generator makes a strange noise, Frank eyeballs it, and it labors on. Buddy walks up, nudges Frank, and nods out at the huge cr Can you believe this?! Charlie walks up and says somethin that we cannot hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacing the cage, Bush peeks out the window. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for it you old ornery sonofabitch, now what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Buddy, and Charlie enter the barn and see Mule hit to the wagon. On the back of the wagon is a simple and rustically elegant casket with the initials FB carved int the center board. It sobers them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Gary, and Theman hide and watch Frank, Buddy and  Charlie walk Mule and the wagon away from the barn and do the road. Carl eyes Bush's shack and starts for it. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, where you going? He said the woods.. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer.
And he takes off. THEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crazy! 147 OMITTED 147 148 OMIT 148

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bluegrass fiddle player nods to the others to quickly the song. Now we see why. Frank, Buddy, and Charlie have brought the wagon with the coffin into the field. Everyon quiets, remembering why they are here. They park the wago behind the hearse. Frank and Charlie walk toward the stage. Buddy peels away Frank calls after him to come with them to the stage but Buddy waves them away. He wants no part of that. He sees Kathryn and Horton threading their way through the crowd moves toward them instead. Frank and Charlie climb the makeshift stairs up to the st Charlie sits down on a folding chair while Frank goes to big microphone and stares with satisfaction at the huge Depression-era Woodstock crowd. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon ladies and gentlemen. I'm Frank Quinn of Quinn Funeral Home. Welcome to the live funeral party of Mr. Felix Bush! People don't know whether to clap or not. Some do and the rest of them pick it up. Buddy gets to Kathryn and hugs her and the baby. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mattie? KATHRYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't come. I don't.. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done some things in my life, but never this. Bet you haven't either, bet no one has. (MORE)
FRANK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winks back at Charlie) We try to make things predictable and safe but if we don't risk everything to get what we want, we don't want it enough. 150 OMIT 150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank finds Buddy in the crowd. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The person who made all of this happen for us doesn't like the spotlight but Buddy Robinson is the heart of Quinn Funeral Home and I'm proud to know him. Buddy is embarrassed and moved. Kathryn's eyes soften.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is sloshing gasoline onto the back porch while Gary Theman keep nervous watch at the farendof porch. Suddenly Carl feels a shotgun's cold metal on his neck and the 45 being ripped from his belt and thrown to the ground. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonsabitches. Carl drops his can. The other men drop their cans but Gar starts to pull a pistol from his back pocket. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, I'll paint the porch with his head. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it! Gary drops the pistol. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now pick up them cans and keep pouring. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?
BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. The men cautiously pick up the cans.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour it on your head. All of it. The men look at each other. Bush cocks the other barrel o his shotgun. THEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't!  BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour it or die, I don't care which. The men hoist the cans and start to pour the gasoline ove them. Burning and spitting they empty the cans. Suddenly Theman bolts, moaning and running blind with gas in his e BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two barrels, anybody else wants to rabbit, now's the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know many of you have heard stories about Mr. Bush. But today I've been told that we're going to hear another kind of story, his. A murmuring moves in a wave across the crowd as they see. .Bush enters the field with his shotgun pointed at Carl a Gary's backs. They are drenched with gas and it is burnin them through their clothes. Buddy, Kathryn, and Horton see Bush. Quinn and Charlie follow the crowd's eyes to Bush. QUINN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Mother of.. SHERIFF DEPUTIES beside the stage see Bush. But everyone remains frozen, not knowing what has happene what to do now. Is this the crazy Bush of the legends?

dialogues.speaker: 89A.
dialogues.text: Buddy starts toward Bush. Kathryn tries to stop him but h pulls free and walks slowly toward Bush. A shot rings out!

Carl and Gary hit the ground like dead men. The crowd hunkers and scatters. Horton steps in front of Kathryn and the baby. Buddy free Charlie rushes up beside Frank at the microphone. Carl rolls up and turns to Bush and sees blood seeping ou onto his shirt beneath his coat. Bush whirls and sees.. .Carl's old 45 still smoking. The gun is in Tom's small shaking hands.. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt him! It's my fault. PLEASE, PLEASE.. Bush cracks his shotgun, walks slowly to the boy, gently takes the 45, empties the shells, and hands the gun back. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second chance is a precious thing, son. Don't waste it. The boy plops down, overwhelmed. And suddenly everyone is in motion. The Deputies run toward Bush. Frank and Charlie rush from stage. Kathryn and Horton are going. Buddy arrives at Bush first and sees the blood weeping on his shirt. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright, sir?! Without turning Bush glances at the Deputies. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried to burn me out. Let the boy be, he didn't mean nothing. As the Deputies get a hold of Carl and Gary, Frank, Charl Kathryn and Horton arrive. Carl looks at Horton with plea eyes and nods to Tom. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help him, Gus, please..
Horton goes to the trembling boy and picks him up. Bush suddenly walks into the trees without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Announcer hangs up the phone on the wall, rushes to t turntable and lifts the tone arm from the record that is playing. ANNOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, I've just received word of a tragic turn of events at the Bush Funeral Party. It seems that Mr. Bush has been shot. I repeat, Mr. Felix Bush has been shot. There is no word of condition..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio is playing but we don't know where Mattie is.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: When I know more I will let you know. I'm sure he would appreciate your prayers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush stands at the mirror, his shirt unbuttoned and pulle back. The bullet caught the muscle just above his clavicl Buddy, Frank and Charlie rush in. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door. Charlie slams the door. Frank examines the wound. Buddy stares in shock at the old roping burns scars on Bush's chest. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed the bone. Got any alcohol and clean rags? Bush nods at the cabinet. Charlie finds an amazing assort of herbs and roots, alcohol and old sheets ripped into ra BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you sit down, sir?
BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boil some water and I'll tell you how to make me a poultice. Frank takes the rags and alcohol from Charlie FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna hurt. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sugar coat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is standing around in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn waits anxiously near the porch with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton steps up to the microphone. The shocked crowd turn him. He closes his eyes and bows his head. REVEREND HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, you say you move in mysterious ways and we believe you because we don't understand much of anything. And so we come to you today not seeking answers to what's happened here but asking you to help us open our hearts a little more to each other and find some forgiveness and understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank has cleaned the wound. Buddy has made a poultice th Bush is pressing onto the wound as he hears the last of Horton's prayer over the loudspeakers. BUS H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good prayer. Mighta been wrong about that preacher. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you lay down, Felix?
Bush thinks about it, sees a way out. For a second he loo like he might take it. Then he shakes his head, puts a ra over the poultice and pulls his shirt up. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go 'fore I lose my nerve. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Bush scowls at the huge blood stain on his shirt. He look Frank's white shirt. Frank just stares at him. Bush keeps looking. Finally Frank sighs and starts loosening his tie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bluegrass band sings a good hymn. The crowd is still stunned and talking, not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy gently helps Bush into his jacket, which has a bull tear in it along the shoulder but Bush seems okay with it Frank's relief. Frank is putting on an old faded shirt of Bush's. As Bush starts for the door, he comes up beside Charlie. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't nervous? All them white folks out there? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's white folks here?! BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick with me, you'll be all right. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one they're shooting at. As Charlie opens the door, Bush stops, all his misgivings flooding in with the light. He looks at Buddy. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty interesting day so far, huh boy? Bush straightens himself up and goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, Bush walk through the murmuring parting crowd to the stage. Frank and Buddy are close behind. Buddy is loo for Kathryn. She spots him and moves toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush and Charlie go up the steps to the stage. At the last second, Bush stares at the big microphone and stops, unable to go on. Charlie gives him a look then goes on up to the microphon and looks out a the sea of white folks. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Reverend Charlie Jackson. Felix wants to continue with his funeral. And he's asked me to say a few words. Just below the stage, Buddy and Frank are joined by Kathr Charlie glances back at Bush, turns inward, searching for words. Finally he holds his hands out, wide apart. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We like to imagine that good and bad, right and wrong, are miles apart. But the truth is, very often they're.. (brings his hand together and laces his fingers TIGHTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .all tangled up with each other. Bush raises his head and looks at Charlie's back. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some 40 years ago Felix Bush dropped into my life and then dropped out. In between he built the most beautiful sanctuary that I've ever seen. A lot of wonderful things happened in that church. Suddenly Bush breaks away, moves up beside Charlie, and p his hand on his shoulder.
BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Charlie. Thank you. Charlie gives him a long look then steps away from the microphone and moves back to where Bush was standing. Bush stares at the microphone, takes a breath, and walks to it, and looks out over the huge crowd. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to go clear to Illinois to find somebody that had anything good to say about me. Hell of a thing. His voice booms out over the crowd, startling him. He loo down, sees Buddy, Kathryn, Frank and Horton. He looks closer for someone most important but she is not there. The crowd murmurs. Finally.. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a smart man or a wise one. I don't know what kind of man I am. I was always restless, thought I'd see the world. But I didn't hardly go nowhere.. on purpose.. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.. because I did something that I was ashamed of. Something I couldn't ever fix. (GLANCES AROUND)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll probably think you know what you'd do or what you wouldn't. And I wish you good luck with that. I really do. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I told Charlie what I'd done, he told me to confess to God and the law and to.. to someone else.. so I could get forgiveness. But I didn't want forgiveness. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed to hold on to what I did.. to be sick from it every day of my life. So I never told nobody else. He stops, not knowing how to go on. The crowd has quieted completely. As as his eyes sweep over the sea of expectant faces, he suddenly SEES HER coming through the crowd.

Mattie's here. Seeing that Felix appears to alright, her changes from conflicted concern to open unbridled hatred. The look takes Bush's breath away. But he suddenly seems accept it as his due and when he talks, it is only to her BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love with a married lady. And somehow she fell in love with me. It was the only time that I have been in love. (GATHERS HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made a plan to run off and start a new life but she didn't show up at the time that we said we'd meet. I got a funny feeling and I went to her house. Buddy, Kathryn and Frank all see Mattie now, see Bush tal just to her. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband answered the door. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had blood on him. For Mattie all of this is like window into the past being suddenly thrown open and she is haunted and mesmerized. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit him pretty hard, knocked him down. Can't remember going upstairs but I remember I saw a hammer on the steps and it had blood and hair on it. The crowd gasps. Mattie is trembling. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found her in the bedroom. She was crawling across the floor. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before I could get to her and help her up.. a kerosene lamp hit the wall. And then her husband jumped on my back. Funny what happens sometimes when things go wrong. It's like the clock stops and you have all the time in the world to think. I could see that her husband had set the downstairs on fire before he came up. (BEAT) (MORE)
BUSH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as I was slamming his head into the wall, trying to get shed of him, I could see clear as anything that it was all my fault. If I'd just never spoke to her.. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as I was thinking about that, I saw that the lamp he threw had set the room we were in on fire too. Bush forces himself to keep looking into Mattie. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I realized that I was on fire. I tried to put myself out but I couldn't, everything was.. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dropped him, turned around and saw her lying on the floor and called her name. She looked up at me.. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .and the next thing I knew, I was flying.. A loud roar of fire and crushing timbers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man on fire bursts through the second story window of a burning house. He lands hard and rolls across the yard to smother the flames. With his clothes still smoking, he unbelievably tries to back into the hell. But the fire is too hot and he cannot screams like a mad man and runs into the trees..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is motionless. Nothing is moving. It is as if t whole world has stopped. Frank, Buddy, and Kathryn are frozen. Bush and Mattie are looking into each other, one anguishe soul to another. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how I got out the window. (BEAT) (MORE)
BUSH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how many times I play it in my mind, I can't remember jumping. I thought I killed him, but maybe he pushed me, I don't know... (lost as ever..) I swear to you, if I left her in there.. everything I know about myself is a lie. But that don't matter. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get her out, Little Bit, I didn't. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush sits on the edge his bed. His face is drawn and haun The door open and closes. He doesn't look up. Mattie sits down beside him. Tears are streaming down her face. She lays her head gently on his shoulder. MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Felix.. He sniffs her hair and tenderly touches it. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder if her hair would be white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN chooses a winning raffle ticket from a wire cage. A poor YOUNG COUPLE with SEVERAL CHILDREN win the raffle! promise of a new and better life begins for them. The big funeral party breaks up people wind their way hom The big old honking generator coughs off. Mule is lead back to the barn. The equipment is disassembled and loaded back on the truc The microphone stands alone on the stage. He got it said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, Frank, Horton, Charlie, and Kathryn and the baby w outside, giving Bush and Mattie time. Buddy takes the bab and holds it close.
Finally Mattie and Bush come out of the shack and walk do to the others. No one knows what to say. Finally.. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, sir? BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fair, son. HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl said Ray paid them to set the fire. Paid them to break into the funeral home too. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't stop pulling Aces out of his ass, can he? HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spend his money on lawyers now. You know how thrifty they are. Frank motions to Buddy and they go to Bush. Buddy is stil holding the baby, Bush looks tenderly at Buddy and the ba BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, Lawrence, after my dad, sir. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't gonna throw rocks at me, is he? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if knows what's good for him. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys did good. Real good. Let's settle up. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to do that now. You get some rest. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look/ then) Yeah. We'll come out tomorrow. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring my shirt back, I just got it broke in.
Bush pulls Buddy aside. Frank stares over at them but can hear what they are saying. He moves over beside Mattie. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Mattie? She looks up at Frank for a long moment, her face softeni MATTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. I'm still moving, I guess.. He doesn't know what that means but she has finally reall looked at him and that's something he'll hold onto. Kathryn comes and hugs Mattie as.. Bush and Buddy come ba Bush goes to Charlie. Frank is staring at Buddy, looking for a clue as to what said. Buddy gives him nothing, BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for coming, Charlie. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you. (MEANING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for my church. BUSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever get my bill? HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get a ride our car's about 2 miles down the road. Everyone piles into the hearse. There is no back seat so all have to crawl in the back door and sit along the side It makes everyone smile. Mattie gives Bush one last fleet embrace then climbs in. Bush looks in on them all for a l moment all then closes the door. As the hearse moves out, he waves to Buddy who is looking the back window. Buddy waves back. BUSH (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. My funeral and everybody's in there but me. The hearse pulls onto the road and drives away.
The place is suddenly quiet and beautiful. He looks down road through the fading dust and sees a WOMAN walking slo toward him. He squints, recognizes her, and his face fill with a timeless love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cold day beneath the spreading pecan tree. Mule st hitched to the wagon. The three dog grave markers are frosted. A fourth grave marker just like the others leans against tree. It is freshly carved with: Felix Elijah Bush. A pot fresh yellow flowers sit beside the marker. Bush's beautiful handmade casket is inside his grave. Frank, Mattie, Charlie, Buddy, Kathryn, and Horton stand beside the grave. Several MEN with shovels wait near the tree. Charlie's eulogy is more of a one-sided conversatio which Bush would probably love. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Felix, this one's for real, I guess. I didn't actually see them put you in the box so.. Charlie glances over and notices "Charlie" on one of the dog's grave markers. He snorts and shakes his head. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever you are, you're probably giving someone a hard time or something wonderful and priceless just to confuse them. Not everything can be figured out, nor everybody. I wish you peace from the burdens of your mind and heart. I wish it for us all. Mattie moves toward the edge of the grave. Frank puts a h out to catch her should she should stumble. She stares do at the FB on the coffin, opens her hand, and lets the pic of her sister drift down onto the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone moves away as the men fill in the grave. Buddy a Kathryn move up beside Frank and Mattie and Charlie. Budd tosses the ball of hermit money to Frank.
BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 50 on the outside, all ones inside. Less than $100. FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. Nobody listens to the preacher. Buddy pulls some papers from his coat. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day of the party he told me about the will he had in the secret drawer of his table. He left the raffle money to all of us. Everyone is shocked, touched. BUDDY (TO FRANK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have to pay for Mule's upkeep for the rest of his life. Charlie grins and Buddy flaps the papers at him. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he set up a fund for the upkeep of your church. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the catch? BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No catch, sir. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still don't get it, do you? With Felix, there's always a catch. BUDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just knew you'd go crazy wondering what it was. They all laugh and move down the hillside. As the laughte fades we see in their faces the impact that Felix Bush ha had upon them. Buddy feels the comfort of this odd but growing family and stops and looks back at the grave and pot of yellow flowers. His curiosity about the fearsome o man has not abated. Nor will it ever.
